issue.title: [Python] More consistent / intuitive name for pyarrow.frombuffer
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2292](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2292). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Now that we have `pyarrow.foreign_buffer`, things are a bit odd. We could call `frombuffer` something like `py_buffer` instead?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2292?focusedCommentId=16392652) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`py_buffer` sounds reasonable to me (it's in line with `to_pylist`, `to_pybytes` etc.).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2292?focusedCommentId=16395626) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
